ArticleTitle.sentence: Intranuclear targeted delivery of functional NF-kappaB by 70 kDa heat shock protein.

event.clue: Intranuclear targeted delivery of functional NF-kappaB by 70 kDa heat shock protein.
Intranuclear targeted delivery of functional NF-kappaB by 70 kDa heat shock protein.

AbstractText.sentence: The 70 kDa heat shock protein (Hsp70) is a highly conserved, ubiquitous protein involved in chaperoning proteins to various cellular organelles.

event.clue: The 70 kDa heat shock protein (Hsp70) is a highly conserved, ubiquitous protein involved in chaperoning proteins to various cellular organelles.
The 70 kDa heat shock protein (Hsp70) is a highly conserved, ubiquitous protein involved in chaperoning proteins to various cellular organelles.

AbstractText.sentence: Here we show that when added exogenously to cells, Hsp70 is readily imported into both cytoplasmic and nuclear compartments in a cell-type-specific fashion.

event.clue: Here we show that when added exogenously to cells, Hsp70 is readily imported into both cytoplasmic and nuclear compartments in a cell-type-specific fashion.
Here we show that when added exogenously to cells, Hsp70 is readily imported into both cytoplasmic and nuclear compartments in a cell-type-specific fashion.

AbstractText.sentence: We exploited this ability of Hsp70 to deliver NF-kappaB, a key transcriptional regulator of inflammatory responses.

event.clue: We exploited this ability of Hsp70 to deliver NF-kappaB, a key transcriptional regulator of inflammatory responses.
We exploited this ability of Hsp70 to deliver NF-kappaB, a key transcriptional regulator of inflammatory responses.
We exploited this ability of Hsp70 to deliver NF-kappaB, a key transcriptional regulator of inflammatory responses.

AbstractText.sentence: We demonstrate that a fusion protein composed of a C-terminal Hsp70 peptide and the p50 subunit of NF-kappaB was directed into the nucleus of cells, could bind DNA specifically, and activated Igkappa expression and TNFalpha production.

event.clue: We demonstrate that a fusion protein composed of a C-terminal Hsp70 peptide and the p50 subunit of NF-kappaB was directed into the nucleus of cells, could bind DNA specifically, and activated Igkappa expression and TNFalpha production.

AbstractText.sentence: We therefore propose that Hsp70 can be used as a vehicle for intracytoplasmic and intranuclear delivery of proteins or DNA to modulate gene expression and thereby control immune responses.
